page.title: 05R.A.F. COLTISHALL
page.content: Royal Air Force Coltishall has been operational as a station since 1940. Originally it was a{fighter station } but in 1974 the first of the{Jaguar} Squadrons arrived. Coltishall is now the home of Nos.{6 and 54 Squadrons } whose role is offensive support, and {41 Squadron}in the day reconnaissance role. No. 6 Squadron has the proud record of being oldest Squadron in the Royal Air Force in terms of continuous service. This squadron, whilst having its own standard, also parades the{Royal {Jordanian}standard presented to it in 1950. No. 54 Squadron was the first to fly Jaguars in the R.A.F. Coltishall is at present the base of {'C' Flight of No. 202 Squadron}flying Sea King helicopters in the Search and Rescue role.
